netrunnerCards.text: The first time you perform the same action three times in a row each turn, gain [Click].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Peace Through Unity
netrunnerCards.title: The Collective: Williams, Wu, et al.

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you make a successful run on a central server each turn, you may force the Corp to draw 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Timing is everything."
netrunnerCards.title: Laramy Fisk: Savvy Investor

netrunnerCards.text: For the first net damage the Runner suffers each turn, you may look at the Runner's grip and select the card that is trashed.
netrunnerCards.title: Chronos Protocol: Selective Mind-mapping

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever the Runner trashes a card for brain damage, he or she removes all copies of that card from the game (installed, in the heap, stack, or grip). The Runner shuffles his or her stack.
netrunnerCards.title: Chronos Protocol: Selective Mind-mapping

netrunnerCards.text:
Draft format only.
You can use agendas from all factions in this deck.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Past is the Future.
netrunnerCards.title: The Shadow: Pulling the Strings

netrunnerCards.text: Draft format only.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "This war is far from over."
netrunnerCards.title: The Masque: Cyber General

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
[Click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Season 1 GNK winner prize
netrunnerCards.title: Crypsis

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], [Click], [Click]: Gain 7[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Season 1 GNK participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Melange Mining Corp.

netrunnerCards.text: Lower the install cost of the first program or piece of hardware you install each turn by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Season 2 GNK winner prize
netrunnerCards.title: Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Season 2 GNK participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Scorched Earth

netrunnerCards.text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[Click]: Do 1 meat damage."
netrunnerCards.flavor: GenCon 2013 participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Private Security Force

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Plugged-in Tour participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Season 3 GNK winner prize
netrunnerCards.title: Datasucker

netrunnerCards.text:
Put 12[Credits] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on this card, trash it.
Take 3[Credits] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Season 3 GNK participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Adonis Campaign

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: 2014 World Championship participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Eli 1.0

netrunnerCards.text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[Click]: Place 3[Credits] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[Click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Store Championship 2014 participation prize.
netrunnerCards.title: Kati Jones

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: 2014 Season One Tournament Kit winner prize
netrunnerCards.title: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [Click].
netrunnerCards.flavor: 2014 Season One Tournament Kit participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Wyldside

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Chronos Protocol Tour participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: NBN: Making News

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Nationals 2014 participation prize.
netrunnerCards.title: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: 2014 Summer Tournament Kit winner prize
netrunnerCards.title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: 2014 Summer Tournament Kit participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Aesop's Pawnshop

netrunnerCards.text: X[Credits], [Trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: 2014 Regionals participation prize
netrunnerCards.title: Corporate Troubleshooter

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Watch this. It'll be funny."
netrunnerCards.title: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire

netrunnerCards.text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.
netrunnerCards.title: Déjà Vu

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).
netrunnerCards.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?
netrunnerCards.title: Demolition Run

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run, and gain 9[Credits], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[Credits] not spent.
netrunnerCards.title: Stimhack

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
netrunnerCards.flavor: I feel almost naked without it
netrunnerCards.title: Cyberfeeder

netrunnerCards.text: +2[Memory Unit] Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard
netrunnerCards.title: Grimoire

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." - g00ru
netrunnerCards.title: Corroder

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
netrunnerCards.title: Datasucker

netrunnerCards.text: Djinn can host up to 3[Memory Unit] of non-icebreaker programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit. [Click], 1[Credits]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.title: Djinn

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D whenever you access cards from R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.
netrunnerCards.title: Medium

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
netrunnerCards.flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
netrunnerCards.title: Mimic

netrunnerCards.text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.
netrunnerCards.title: Parasite

netrunnerCards.text:
3[Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 0 or less strength.
1[Credits]: Ice has -1 strength.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Fire and ichor…
netrunnerCards.title: Wyrm

netrunnerCards.text: 0[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!
netrunnerCards.title: Yog.0

netrunnerCards.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
netrunnerCards.title: Ice Carver

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [Click].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside." - Ji "Noise" Reilly
netrunnerCards.title: Wyldside

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
netrunnerCards.title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lose up to 5[Credits], then you gain 2[Credits] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.
netrunnerCards.title: Account Siphon

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 3[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. Be thankfully I got just the ticket…"
netrunnerCards.title: Easy Mark

netrunnerCards.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
netrunnerCards.title: Forged Activation Orders

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
netrunnerCards.title: Inside Job

netrunnerCards.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
netrunnerCards.title: Special Order

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], 1[Credits]: Expose 1 card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "A little preparation goes a long way." -Gabriel Santiago
netrunnerCards.title: Lemuria Codecracker

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Gain 1[Credits] whenever you make a successful run. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: Desperado

netrunnerCards.text: 2[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
netrunnerCards.title: Aurora

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may spend 1[Credits] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
netrunnerCards.title: Femme Fatale

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[Credits]: +5 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.
netrunnerCards.title: Ninja

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." - g00ru
netrunnerCards.title: Sneakdoor Beta

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 8[Credits] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
netrunnerCards.title: Bank Job

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[Trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection."
-Lez "Rockfist" S.
netrunnerCards.title: Crash Space

netrunnerCards.text: Forfeit an agenda, [Click]: Gain 9[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.
netrunnerCards.title: Data Dealer

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Avoid receiving 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank."
"What makes you say that, D?"
"The curlers."
netrunnerCards.title: Decoy

netrunnerCards.text: Lower the install cost of the first program or piece of hardware you install each turn by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Are you listening?"
netrunnerCards.title: Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker

netrunnerCards.text: Draw 3 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
netrunnerCards.title: Diesel

netrunnerCards.text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
netrunnerCards.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
netrunnerCards.title: Modded

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak
netrunnerCards.title: The Maker's Eye

netrunnerCards.text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
netrunnerCards.title: Tinkering

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit]
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.
netrunnerCards.title: Akamatsu Mem Chip

netrunnerCards.text:
+1[Link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.
netrunnerCards.title: Rabbit Hole

netrunnerCards.text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
netrunnerCards.title: The Personal Touch

netrunnerCards.text: +2[Memory Unit] +2[Link] 2[Recurring Credits] Use the credits to pay for using icebreakers. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: The Toolbox

netrunnerCards.text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
netrunnerCards.title: Battering Ram

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
netrunnerCards.title: Gordian Blade

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Gain 2[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
netrunnerCards.title: Magnum Opus

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Prevent the first net damage this turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sucks energy like a martian terra-bot, but it keeps you focused
netrunnerCards.title: Net Shield

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.title: Pipeline

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
netrunnerCards.title: Aesop's Pawnshop

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
netrunnerCards.title: Sacrificial Construct

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 2[Credits] or expose 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
netrunnerCards.title: Infiltration

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 9[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
netrunnerCards.title: Sure Gamble

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
[Click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
netrunnerCards.title: Crypsis

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Link]
netrunnerCards.flavor: He flicked the display population to high, and was surrounded by a circle of floating holos. The ping-back was strong, the clearance level blue-one. Now to find the perfect place for a relay…
netrunnerCards.title: Access to Globalsec

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 12[Credits] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.

[Click]: Take 2[Credits] from Armitage Codebusting.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
netrunnerCards.title: Armitage Codebusting

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Effective. Reliable. Humane.
netrunnerCards.title: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.
netrunnerCards.title: Accelerated Beta Test

netrunnerCards.text:
Put 12[Credits] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[Credits] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
netrunnerCards.title: Adonis Campaign

netrunnerCards.text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[Credits] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
netrunnerCards.title: Aggressive Secretary

netrunnerCards.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
netrunnerCards.title: Archived Memories

netrunnerCards.text: Gain [Click] [Click].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
netrunnerCards.title: Biotic Labor

netrunnerCards.text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).
netrunnerCards.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.
netrunnerCards.title: Shipment from MirrorMorph

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
netrunnerCards.title: Heimdall 1.0

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trace1– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
netrunnerCards.title: Ichi 1.0

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
netrunnerCards.title: Viktor 1.0

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Whrrrrr!
netrunnerCards.title: Rototurret

netrunnerCards.text: X[Credits], [Trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I solve problems."
netrunnerCards.title: Corporate Troubleshooter

netrunnerCards.text: All ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only gong to make things worse, he thought.
netrunnerCards.title: Experiential Data

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
netrunnerCards.title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

netrunnerCards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
netrunnerCards.title: Nisei MK II

netrunnerCards.text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[Credits] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
netrunnerCards.title: Project Junebug

netrunnerCards.text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.

If you pay 4[Credits] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
netrunnerCards.title: Snare!

netrunnerCards.text:
If the Runner is about to expose a card, you may rez Zaibatsu Loyalty.
1[Credits] or [Trash]: Prevent 1 card from being exposed.
netrunnerCards.title: Zaibatsu Loyalty

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
netrunnerCards.title: Neural EMP

netrunnerCards.text: Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
netrunnerCards.flavor: There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything and nothing.
netrunnerCards.title: Precognition

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner approaches the outermost piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Derez Cell Portal.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Where does it go?"
netrunnerCards.title: Cell Portal

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters during this run has +2 strength. Do 3 net damage unless the Runner breaks all subroutines on that piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." - Ji "Noise" Reilly
netrunnerCards.title: Chum

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. Trash Data Mine.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n
netrunnerCards.title: Data Mine

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
netrunnerCards.title: Neural Katana

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
netrunnerCards.title: Wall of Thorns

netrunnerCards.text: The rez cost of ice protecting this server is lowered by 2.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.
netrunnerCards.title: Akitaro Watanabe

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
netrunnerCards.title: NBN: Making News

netrunnerCards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.title: AstroScript Pilot Program

netrunnerCards.text:
When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags.

When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.
netrunnerCards.title: Breaking News

netrunnerCards.text: Draw 3 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"
netrunnerCards.title: Anonymous Tip

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
netrunnerCards.title: Closed Accounts

netrunnerCards.text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.
netrunnerCards.title: Psychographics

netrunnerCards.text: Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn. Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." - Jerome Lock, on-duty tech
netrunnerCards.title: SEA Source

netrunnerCards.text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
netrunnerCards.title: Ghost Branch

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
netrunnerCards.title: Data Raven

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Matrix Analyzer, you may pay 1[Credits] to place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.
netrunnerCards.title: Matrix Analyzer

netrunnerCards.text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
netrunnerCards.title: Tollbooth

netrunnerCards.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[Credits] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.
netrunnerCards.title: Red Herrings

netrunnerCards.text: The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."
netrunnerCards.title: SanSan City Grid

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever you play a transaction operation.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Moving Upwards.
netrunnerCards.title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7[Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
netrunnerCards.title: Hostile Takeover

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "If some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of BosWash. Not to mention off-planet."
netrunnerCards.title: Posted Bounty

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], trash a rezzed piece of ice: Gain 4[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." - Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security
netrunnerCards.title: Security Subcontract

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if you scored an agenda this turn.
Search R&D for 1 card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms are quite favorable."
netrunnerCards.title: Aggressive Negotiation

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 3[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
netrunnerCards.title: Beanstalk Royalties

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries…"
netrunnerCards.title: Scorched Earth

netrunnerCards.text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."
netrunnerCards.title: Shipment from Kaguya

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[Subroutine] The Corp gains 2[Credits].
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.
netrunnerCards.title: Archer

netrunnerCards.text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though." -g00ru
netrunnerCards.title: Hadrian's Wall

netrunnerCards.text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
netrunnerCards.title: Ice Wall

netrunnerCards.text: Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it. [Subroutine] The Corp gains 2[Credits]. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows.
-unsigned cyber-graffiti
netrunnerCards.title: Shadow

netrunnerCards.text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
Your maximum hand size is +2.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."
netrunnerCards.title: Research Station

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"
netrunnerCards.title: Priority Requisition

netrunnerCards.text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[Click]: Do 1 meat damage."
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
netrunnerCards.title: Private Security Force

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], [Click], [Click]: Gain 7[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
netrunnerCards.title: Melange Mining Corp.

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] when your turn begins.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.
netrunnerCards.title: PAD Campaign

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 9[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor:
Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt.
-The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
netrunnerCards.title: Hedge Fund

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."
netrunnerCards.title: Enigma

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR
netrunnerCards.title: Hunter

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak
netrunnerCards.title: Wall of Static

netrunnerCards.text:
3[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Running is the ultimate game, and I get to make all the rules."
netrunnerCards.title: Whizzard: Master Gamer

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit], 2[Recurring Credits] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: Spinal Modem

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed.
Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed).
netrunnerCards.flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
netrunnerCards.title: Imp

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
netrunnerCards.title: Morning Star

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Choose a piece of ice. The Corp must pay 2[Credits] as an additional cost to rez that ice until the end of the turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Named after Hernando Cortez, a former Weyland technician convicted of smuggling company tech. He still collected his pension while in prison, the last beneficiary of a loophole in Weyland's standard employment contract.
netrunnerCards.title: Cortez Chip

netrunnerCards.text: 2[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Show-off.
netrunnerCards.title: Peacock

netrunnerCards.text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of ZU.13 Key Master is 0, even if it is not installed. 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: He always uses the same key.
netrunnerCards.title: ZU.13 Key Master

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Link] [Trash]: Choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "What causes an Artifical Intellegence to turn on its master? Is it because its directives have been altered by some external source? Or, by giving them agency to adapt, have we fated them to revolt?" - Emilio Harris, Creators and the Created
netrunnerCards.title: The Helpful AI

netrunnerCards.text: Place 4 power counters on Plascrete Carapace when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Plascrete Carapace, trash it. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
netrunnerCards.title: Plascrete Carapace

netrunnerCards.text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
netrunnerCards.title: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

netrunnerCards.text: You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sometimes employee reviews took a little bit longer than anticipated.
netrunnerCards.title: Mandatory Upgrades

netrunnerCards.text:
The runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Janus 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Face your fear.
netrunnerCards.title: Janus 1.0

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace4– if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Eyes forward please."
netrunnerCards.title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

netrunnerCards.text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.
netrunnerCards.title: Braintrust

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. End the run if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sometimes uniqueness is overrated.
netrunnerCards.title: Snowflake

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "We're gonna need a bigger room."
netrunnerCards.title: Restructured Datapool

netrunnerCards.text: When you rez TMI, trace2– if unsuccessful, derez TMI. [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A collection of cast-off cyberjunk. But it doesn't stay junk for long.
netrunnerCards.title: TMI

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
netrunnerCards.title: Project Atlas

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, the Corp gains 3[Credits]. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, end the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.
netrunnerCards.title: Caduceus

netrunnerCards.text: When you rez Dracō, you may pay X[Credits] to place X power counters on it. Dracō has +1 strength for each power counter on it. [Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Victōs draconēs numquam deride.
netrunnerCards.title: Dracō

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may pay X[Credits] to force the Corp to lose up to X[Credits], then take 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor: There was a certain schadenfreude about throwing away your credits.
netrunnerCards.title: Vamp

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 16[Credits] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[Click]: Take 4[Credits] from Liberated Account.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
netrunnerCards.title: Liberated Account

netrunnerCards.text: Expose up to 2 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: T-minus 13 seconds. Leela had to work fast. She jacked in the mesa wire and activated the screen. 7 seconds. The internal SLD was still booting. 4 seconds. The interface flickered to life with an orange glow. 2 seconds. With a tap of a finger she was in.
netrunnerCards.title: Satellite Uplink

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you break a subroutine on a piece of ice, you may pay 1[Credits] to break 1 additional subroutine on that ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: CyberSolutions' e3 line of implants trade strictly in muscle memory and automatic responses, freeing the brain to focus entirely on cerebral tasks.
netrunnerCards.title: e3 Feedback Implants

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit during traces.
Gain 1[Credits] whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.title: Compromised Employee

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
netrunnerCards.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
netrunnerCards.title: Notoriety

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength. Whenever you use Snowball to break a subroutine, it has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "If your snowball gets big enough, you can make it into a snowman!" - Chaos Theory
netrunnerCards.title: Snowball

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit], +1[Link]
netrunnerCards.flavor: Archaic but reliable.
netrunnerCards.title: Dyson Mem Chip

netrunnerCards.text: The trash cost of all installed cards is increased by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The key to the future lies in the past.
netrunnerCards.title: Encryption Protocol

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Sherlock 1.0. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.
netrunnerCards.title: Sherlock 1.0

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.
netrunnerCards.title: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection

netrunnerCards.text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2[Credits].
netrunnerCards.title: Fetal AI

netrunnerCards.text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
netrunnerCards.title: Trick of Light

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] For the remainder of this run, each piece of ice encountered except Sensei gains "[Subroutine] End the run" after all its other subroutines.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Peace and violence. Both must lead to the same place.
netrunnerCards.title: Sensei

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Give the Runner 2 tags.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Looking out for your interests since 1984.
netrunnerCards.title: Big Brother

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever there is a successful trace during a run on this server, give the Runner 1 tag. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Clones whisper of ChiLo as a promised land of freedom.
netrunnerCards.title: ChiLo City Grid

netrunnerCards.text: Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn. Trace2– If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.
netrunnerCards.title: Power Grid Overload

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you install a piece of ice protecting this server, you may immediately rez it, lowering its rez cost by 3. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.title: Amazon Industrial Zone

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Executive Retreat, place 1 agenda counter on it and shuffle HQ into R&D. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Draw 5 cards.
netrunnerCards.title: Executive Retreat

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash up to 2 resources.
netrunnerCards.flavor: No contract. Just a handshake and a fistful of C-6 high explosives.
netrunnerCards.title: Freelancer

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Nerve Agent.
Each virus counter after the first on Nerve Agent allows you to access 1 additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ.
netrunnerCards.title: Nerve Agent

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may gain [Click]. If you do, take 1 tag when this turn ends.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "My enhancements are guaranteed for life, and well worth the risk."
netrunnerCards.title: Joshua B.

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
netrunnerCards.title: Emergency Shutdown

netrunnerCards.text: Prevent the first meat damage each turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Light and form-fitting, its like bulletproof skin.
netrunnerCards.title: Muresh Bodysuit

netrunnerCards.text: Once per run, you may expose an unrezzed piece of ice when you approach it. You may then jack out.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "A snitch is a girl's best friend." - Andromeda
netrunnerCards.title: Snitch

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit]
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
netrunnerCards.title: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

netrunnerCards.text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
netrunnerCards.title: Test Run

netrunnerCards.text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: Dinosaurus

netrunnerCards.text:
[Click]: Host a program or piece of hardware from your grip on Personal Workshop and place power counters on it equal to its install cost.
1[Credits]: Remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When there are no power counters left on a hosted card, install it, ignoring all costs.
netrunnerCards.title: Personal Workshop

netrunnerCards.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I'm just thankful that the brain damage is reversible. With the support of the city of New Angeles, I hope to be on my feet and back to practicing my art very soon." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
netrunnerCards.title: Public Sympathy

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
netrunnerCards.title: Project Vitruvius

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, the Runner loses [Click], if able. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, end the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Dont Tread On Me
netrunnerCards.title: Viper

netrunnerCards.text: If Edge of World is installed and you pay 3[Credits] when the Runner accesses it, do 1 brain damage for each piece of ice protecting this server.
netrunnerCards.title: Edge of World

netrunnerCards.text: Choose a server. Arrange the ice protecting that server in any order.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "You haven't run until you've seen the cybersun drift down behind the Great City, the space around you rippling with colors you can't imagine." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
netrunnerCards.title: Sunset

netrunnerCards.text:
When your turn begins, take 1[Credits] from Marked Accounts, if able.
[Click]: Place 3[Credits] from the bank on Marked Accounts.
netrunnerCards.title: Marked Accounts

netrunnerCards.text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." - Chaos Theory
netrunnerCards.title: Pop-up Window

netrunnerCards.text: Woodcutter can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each advancement token on it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Chop chop.
netrunnerCards.title: Woodcutter

netrunnerCards.text: Choose a piece of ice. Gain 1[Credits] for each advancement token on that ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Division of Fringe Applications' revenue increased 37% year-over-year after corporate discovered that most of their projects made really fun toys.
netrunnerCards.title: Commercialization

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 14[Credits] from the bank on Private Contracts when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Private Contracts, trash it.
[Click]: Take 2[Credits] from Private Contracts.
netrunnerCards.title: Private Contracts

netrunnerCards.text: When you rez Chimera, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier. Chimera gains that subtype until derezzed. When a turn ends, derez Chimera. [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Three heads. One big headache.
netrunnerCards.title: Chimera

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Prevent a trace. That trace initiates again with a base trace strength of 0.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Saved my bacon more than once, but gives a wicked sense of déjà vu." - Whizzard
netrunnerCards.title: Disrupter

netrunnerCards.text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It always strikes twice.
netrunnerCards.title: Force of Nature

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." - Ji "Noise" Reilly
netrunnerCards.title: Scrubber

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Twice the fun.
netrunnerCards.title: Doppelgänger

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Derez a piece of ice. Use this ability only after breaking all the subroutines of that ice during a single encounter.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Cyberspace's strongest glue.
netrunnerCards.title: Crescentus

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines. [Trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Didn't see that coming.
netrunnerCards.title: Deus X

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], [Trash]: Gain [Click] [Click].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour
netrunnerCards.title: All-nighter

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install hardware.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Few corporate employees have such wide-sweeping security clearance as the janitorial staff. Most corps foolishly think they're too dim-witted to take advantage of it.
netrunnerCards.title: Inside Man

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[Credits] if you have at least 2[Link].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
netrunnerCards.title: Underworld Contact

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 3[Credits] and draw 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
netrunnerCards.title: Green Level Clearance

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Time just slips away.
netrunnerCards.title: Hourglass

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to rez ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
so very still, even
cherry blossoms are not stirred
by the temple bell
           -Fuhaku
netrunnerCards.title: Dedicated Server

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits] or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, move Bullfrog so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server).
netrunnerCards.title: Bullfrog

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, the Runner cannot make another run this turn. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, end the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Where one thing ends, another begins.
netrunnerCards.title: Uroboros

netrunnerCards.text:
X[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during traces. X is the number of links the Runner has.
netrunnerCards.flavor: This is the net. We work here. We're cops.
netrunnerCards.title: Net Police

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to advance ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Constructing Cyberspace.
netrunnerCards.title: Weyland Consortium: Because We Built It

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 4[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: It's really hard to lose a government contract.
netrunnerCards.title: Government Contracts

netrunnerCards.text: Tyrant can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Thou shall not pass.
netrunnerCards.title: Tyrant

netrunnerCards.text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
netrunnerCards.title: Oversight AI

netrunnerCards.text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [Click][Click], if able.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.
netrunnerCards.title: False Lead

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if you placed at least 1 virus counter on a program this turn.
Place 2 virus counters on that program.
netrunnerCards.flavor: You must yell "surge" to get the full effect.
netrunnerCards.title: Surge

netrunnerCards.text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
netrunnerCards.title: Xanadu

netrunnerCards.text: You draw a starting hand of 9 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I run with the best."
netrunnerCards.title: Andromeda: Dispossessed Ristie

netrunnerCards.text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1[Credits] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.
netrunnerCards.title: Networking

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
netrunnerCards.title: HQ Interface

netrunnerCards.text:
X[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.
netrunnerCards.title: Pheromones

netrunnerCards.text: Draw 5 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: She at her P.A.D. I at my rig. Low lights. Smooth jazz. Love blooms.
netrunnerCards.title: Quality Time

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware (including Replicator), you may search your stack for another copy of that hardware, reveal it, and add it your grip. Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Do you really need another one?
netrunnerCards.title: Replicator

netrunnerCards.text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of Creeper is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"The itsy bitsy spider went up the data spout…"
-Chaos Theory
netrunnerCards.title: Creeper

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if you stole an agenda this turn.
Choose a server. The Corp trashes 1 piece of ice protecting that server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Early permutations of the kraken proved to be insatiable, ice-devouring marauders. Not much has changed.
netrunnerCards.title: Kraken

netrunnerCards.text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[Click]: Place 3[Credits] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[Click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."
netrunnerCards.title: Kati Jones

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 16[Credits] from the bank on Eve Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Eve Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[Credits] from Eve Campaign.
netrunnerCards.title: Eve Campaign

netrunnerCards.text: Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Also known as "development hell."
netrunnerCards.title: Rework

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru
netrunnerCards.title: Whirlpool

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
netrunnerCards.title: Hokusai Grid

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, look at a number of cards from the top of the Runner's stack equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength. Trash 1 of those cards, and arrange the rest in any order.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sniff.
netrunnerCards.title: Data Hound

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace5– if successful, give the runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.
netrunnerCards.title: Bernice Mai

netrunnerCards.text: Salvage can be advanced only while rezzed and gains “[Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.” for each advancement token on it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: You're not in Kansas anymore.
netrunnerCards.title: Salvage

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to advance cards in or protecting this server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "A job done once is a job done right."
netrunnerCards.title: Simone Diego

netrunnerCards.text: Trace7– If successful, trash 1 virtual resource or 1 link.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It's kind of like an anagram." -designer Phoenix
netrunnerCards.title: Foxfire

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
netrunnerCards.title: Retrieval Run

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[Credits] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.
netrunnerCards.title: Darwin

netrunnerCards.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
If you are tagged, Data Leak Reversal gains "[Click]: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D."
netrunnerCards.flavor: A two-way solution to a one-way problem, the data leak reversal, or DLR for short, is a misnomer. There is no actual reversal of data, only the creation of a parallel peer-to-peer link with the initial source.
netrunnerCards.title: Data Leak Reversal

netrunnerCards.text: 0[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
netrunnerCards.title: Faerie

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
netrunnerCards.title: Mr. Li

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
netrunnerCards.title: Indexing

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Works best at your own desk.
netrunnerCards.title: R&D Interface

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Deep Thought.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Deep Thought, it gains "When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of R&D."
netrunnerCards.title: Deep Thought

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Credits]: Avoid 1 tag.
Trash New Angeles City Hall when you steal an agenda.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "New Angeles is the jewel of modern civilization, and its government the envy of nations." -Mayor Wells
netrunnerCards.title: New Angeles City Hall

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."
netrunnerCards.title: Eli 1.0

netrunnerCards.text: As an additional cost to make a run on this server, the Runner must spend [Click]. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Known for luxury hoppers and a delectable sauerkraut.
netrunnerCards.title: Ruhr Valley

netrunnerCards.text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[Click], [Trash]: Do 3 net damage."
netrunnerCards.flavor: I will serve you…for a time.
netrunnerCards.title: Ronin

netrunnerCards.text: Once per run, when the Runner approaches a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with a piece of ice from HQ. The new ice is installed unrezzed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Looks like someone is being naughty…"
netrunnerCards.title: Midori

netrunnerCards.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: *Some restrictions may apply. Scan this card to find out more.
netrunnerCards.title: NBN: The World is Yours*

netrunnerCards.text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
netrunnerCards.title: Project Beale

netrunnerCards.text: Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn. Trace6– If successful, give the Runner tags equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.
netrunnerCards.title: Midseason Replacements

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine]Trace6– If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.
netrunnerCards.title: Flare

netrunnerCards.text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
netrunnerCards.flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing
netrunnerCards.title: Dedicated Response Team

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace0– If successful, the Runner trashes 1 program.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "If I had to describe the bugs in one word, it would be '****ing annoying.'" -Whizzard
netrunnerCards.title: Burke Bugs

netrunnerCards.text: If you have at least 7[Credits] when you score Corporate War, gain 7[Credits]; otherwise, lose all credits in your credit pool.
netrunnerCards.flavor: There were several ways to win a corporate war. One of them was to bring out the bazookas.
netrunnerCards.title: Corporate War

netrunnerCards.text: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.
netrunnerCards.title: Cerebral Imaging: Infinite Frontiers

netrunnerCards.text: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Once and Future Android.
netrunnerCards.title: Custom Biotics: Engineered for Success

netrunnerCards.text: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.
netrunnerCards.title: NEXT Design: Guarding the Net

netrunnerCards.text:
When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs.
Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Director Haas' Pet Project

netrunnerCards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [Click][Click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.
netrunnerCards.title: Efficiency Committee

netrunnerCards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.
netrunnerCards.title: Project Wotan

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" -Director Haas
netrunnerCards.title: Sentinel Defense Program

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card.
[Click],[Trash]: Gain 2[Credits] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.
netrunnerCards.title: Alix T4LB07

netrunnerCards.text:
Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced.
If you pay 3[Credits] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.
netrunnerCards.title: Cerebral Overwriter

netrunnerCards.text:
You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
netrunnerCards.title: Director Haas

netrunnerCards.text: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. [Click], hosted advancement token: Gain [Click][Click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
netrunnerCards.title: Haas Arcology AI

netrunnerCards.text:
Thomas Haas can be advanced.
[Trash]: Gain 2[Credits] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite pastime appears to be disappointing his mother.
netrunnerCards.title: Thomas Haas

netrunnerCards.text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
netrunnerCards.title: Bioroid Efficiency Research

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.
netrunnerCards.title: Successful Demonstration

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.
netrunnerCards.title: Heimdall 2.0

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." -g00ru
netrunnerCards.title: Howler

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The game has changed.
netrunnerCards.title: Ichi 2.0

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as the outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.
netrunnerCards.title: Minelayer

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.title: Viktor 2.0

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0.
[Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?
netrunnerCards.title: Zed 1.0

netrunnerCards.text: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece is installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7[Credits], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.
netrunnerCards.title: Awakening Center

netrunnerCards.text: If the Runner is about to break a subroutine on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server, you may rez Tyr's Hand. [Trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server.
netrunnerCards.title: Tyr's Hand

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 3[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth
netrunnerCards.title: Gila Hands Arcology

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], 1[Credits]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." -g00ru
netrunnerCards.title: Levy University

netrunnerCards.text:
Gain 2[Credits] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "There's only a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."
netrunnerCards.title: Server Diagnostics

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.
netrunnerCards.title: Bastion

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2[Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
netrunnerCards.title: Datapike

netrunnerCards.text: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
netrunnerCards.title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

netrunnerCards.text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "New technology destroys the old."
netrunnerCards.title: The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I can make that work."
netrunnerCards.title: Exile: Streethawk

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.
netrunnerCards.title: Escher

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Wheeeee!
netrunnerCards.title: Exploratory Romp

netrunnerCards.text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2[Credits] for each program trashed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas
netrunnerCards.title: Freelance Coding Contract

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this card, trash an installed program.
Install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: One man's trash.
netrunnerCards.title: Scavenge

netrunnerCards.text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.
netrunnerCards.title: Levy AR Lab Access

netrunnerCards.text: +3[Memory Unit] When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4[Credits]. Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: Monolith

netrunnerCards.text:
3[Credits]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[Trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.
netrunnerCards.title: Feedback Filter

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
netrunnerCards.flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.
netrunnerCards.title: Clone Chip

netrunnerCards.text:
Omni-Drive can host a single program of 1[Memory Unit] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.
netrunnerCards.title: Omni-Drive

netrunnerCards.text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[Credits] to put X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
netrunnerCards.title: Atman

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall…"
netrunnerCards.title: Cloak

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "…and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." -revenant
netrunnerCards.title: Dagger

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
netrunnerCards.title: Chakana

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can only be used during a run on the chosen server.
netrunnerCards.title: Cyber-Cypher

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash assets.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.
netrunnerCards.title: Paricia

netrunnerCards.text: 2[Credits], [Trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." - The Professor
netrunnerCards.title: Self-modifying Code

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).
netrunnerCards.flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.
netrunnerCards.title: Sahasrara

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor
netrunnerCards.title: Inti

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Gain 1[Credits] and draw 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig his, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
netrunnerCards.title: Professional Contacts

netrunnerCards.text:
+1[Link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.
netrunnerCards.title: Borrowed Satellite

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[Credits] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
netrunnerCards.title: Ice Analyzer

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[Credits] if it was successful.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
netrunnerCards.title: Dirty Laundry

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 8[Credits] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it.
Take 2[Credits] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert.
netrunnerCards.title: Daily Casts

netrunnerCards.text: [Click], [Click], [Trash]: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).
netrunnerCards.flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.
netrunnerCards.title: Same Old Thing

netrunnerCards.text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3[Credits].
