Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.
netrunnerCards.title: The Source

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Forfeit an agenda. If you do, give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." -Noise
netrunnerCards.title: Frame Job

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Host Pawn on an outermost piece of ice protecting a central server. Whenever you make a successful run, move Pawn to the piece of ice directly after the current ice hosting Pawn, if able; otherwise, trash Pawn instead and install a Caïssa program from your grip or heap, ignoring all costs.
netrunnerCards.title: Pawn

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server. The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.
netrunnerCards.title: Rook

netrunnerCards.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.title: Hostage

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever the corp spends a [Click] to draw 1 card or gain 1[Credits] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 1[Credits] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.
netrunnerCards.title: Gorman Drip v1

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using decoders.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
netrunnerCards.title: Lockpick

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
netrunnerCards.title: False Echo

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Normal people–sane people–do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, or the ever-popular lust for money? -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
netrunnerCards.title: Motivation

netrunnerCards.text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."
netrunnerCards.title: John Masanori

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Who wants to start a war?
netrunnerCards.title: Project Ares

netrunnerCards.text: NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.
netrunnerCards.title: NEXT Bronze

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[Credits] for each card revealed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
netrunnerCards.title: Celebrity Gift

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Credits]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
netrunnerCards.title: Himitsu-Bako

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." -The Professor
netrunnerCards.title: Character Assassination

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Draw 2 cards. Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives to R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."
netrunnerCards.title: Jackson Howard

netrunnerCards.text: As additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click]. Trace2– If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.title: Invasion of Privacy

netrunnerCards.text: Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7[Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.
netrunnerCards.title: Geothermal Fracking

netrunnerCards.text:
When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity.
Swarm can be advanced and gains "[Subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the Runner pays 3[Credits]." for each advancement token on it.
netrunnerCards.title: Swarm

netrunnerCards.text: Purge virus counters.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Your free trial expired. Upgrade to the full version?
netrunnerCards.title: Cyberdex Trial

netrunnerCards.text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of many so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." -The Professor
netrunnerCards.title: Grim

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Host Bishop on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Bishop can be hosted only on ice protecting a central server if Bishop is on ice protecting a remote server, or on ice protecting a remote server if Bishop is on ice protecting a central server. Host ice has -2 strength.
netrunnerCards.title: Bishop

netrunnerCards.text:
Scheherazade can host any number of programs.
Whenever you install a program on Scheherazade, gain 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.
netrunnerCards.title: Scheherazade

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, gain 2[Credits] and lose [Click].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Noise decided to go back to school. He applied for research grants at fifteen of the most prestigious universities. Then he hacked in and approved his applications. Breakfast time.
netrunnerCards.title: Hard at Work

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run. You may jack out when you encounter the first piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Just like in the real world, sometimes it is best to send in the clone to do the dirty work.
netrunnerCards.title: Recon

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you pass a piece of ice, you may trash Copycat. If you do, choose another rezzed copy of that piece of ice protecting any server. The run continues as if you had just passed the chosen piece of ice (you are now running from the new position).
netrunnerCards.flavor: The copycat function should be used with extreme caution, or you might end up on the wrong side of cyberspace.
netrunnerCards.title: Copycat

netrunnerCards.text: 3[Credits]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines. 3[Credits]: +5 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It's efficient as all hell, for certain very large values of "efficient". The whale avatar is either a nice touch or a tragic misapplication of programmer man-hour, depending on who you ask. -BT's Guide to Icebreaking
netrunnerCards.title: Leviathan

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Reveal the top card of your stack. You may install that card, lowering the install cost by 10[Credits], if able; otherwise, trash it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I've got a surprise for you."
netrunnerCards.title: Eureka!

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards you may choose 1 faceup card from Archives and add it to the top of R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Why is data deleted? Maybe they don't want it to be found. Or maybe it's just useless. The useless data is the kind you want." -The Professor
netrunnerCards.title: Record Reconstructor

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to play events.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.
netrunnerCards.title: Prepaid VoicePAD

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [Click][Click].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 3[Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 installed program.
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner takes 1 brain damage.
netrunnerCards.title: Wotan

netrunnerCards.text: Play only if the Runner installed a resource on his or her last turn. Trace2– If successful, add 1 installed resource to the top of the Runner's stack. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.title: Hellion Alpha Test

netrunnerCards.text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "They call it 'retirement'. I call it 'euthenasia'." -Ken "Express" Tenma
netrunnerCards.title: Clone Retirement

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [Subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
netrunnerCards.title: Swordsman

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.
netrunnerCards.title: Shipment from SanSan

netrunnerCards.text: When you rez Muckraker, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trace1– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
netrunnerCards.title: Muckraker

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
netrunnerCards.title: The Cleaners

netrunnerCards.text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [Click], [Trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
netrunnerCards.title: Elizabeth Mills

netrunnerCards.text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server. 
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.
netrunnerCards.title: Off the Grid

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5[Credits] for each bad publicity taken.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.
netrunnerCards.title: Profiteering

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 15[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".
netrunnerCards.title: Restructure

netrunnerCards.text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
netrunnerCards.title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

netrunnerCards.text: +3[Memory Unit] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caïssa programs. Whenever you install a Caïssa program, you may trigger its [Click] ability without spending [Click]. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: Deep Red

netrunnerCards.text: 2[Credits]: Break subroutine on host ice. [Click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.
netrunnerCards.flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.
netrunnerCards.title: Knight

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[Credits] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.
netrunnerCards.title: Running Interference

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may reveal all cards in HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.
netrunnerCards.title: Expert Schedule Analyzer

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn ends, gain 1[Credits] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.
netrunnerCards.flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.
netrunnerCards.title: Grifter

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.
netrunnerCards.title: Torch

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Looks can be deceiving.
netrunnerCards.title: Woman in the Red Dress

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever the Corp takes at least 1 bad publicity, access 1 card from HQ.
[Trash]: Expose 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.
netrunnerCards.title: Raymond Flint

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"
netrunnerCards.title: Isabel McGuire

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
netrunnerCards.title: Hudson 1.0

netrunnerCards.text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
netrunnerCards.title: Accelerated Diagnostics

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.
netrunnerCards.title: Unorthodox Predictions

netrunnerCards.text: The first time the Runner spends at least 1 [Click] on his or her turn, gain 2[Credits] unless the Runner just initiated a run on this server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
netrunnerCards.title: Sundew

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.
netrunnerCards.title: City Surveillance

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.
netrunnerCards.title: Snoop

netrunnerCards.text: Ireress gains "[Subroutine] The Runner loses 1[Credits]" for each bad publicity you have.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Say it really fast.
netrunnerCards.title: Ireress

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less.
netrunnerCards.title: Power Shutdown

netrunnerCards.text:
If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It folds under pressure.
netrunnerCards.title: Paper Wall

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."
netrunnerCards.title: Interns

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, look at the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of those cards at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and the Corp shuffles R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.
netrunnerCards.title: Keyhole

netrunnerCards.text:
When the Corp turn begins, take 1 tag if you have no tags.
When your turn begins, give the Corp 1 bad publicity if he or she has no bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "They call me a terrorist to scare people. If they want to find terrorists, maybe they should start by looking in the mirror." -Reina Roja
netrunnerCards.title: Activist Support

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Remove up to 2 tags and draw 3 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Pros don't need to call their lawyer. Pros have their secretary rigged to do it for them if they ever go off-grid.
netrunnerCards.title: Lawyer Up

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Prevent all damage until the beginning of your next turn unless the Corp takes 2 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Care to have a look?"
netrunnerCards.title: Leverage

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.
netrunnerCards.title: Garrote

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you install an icebreaker, that icebreaker has +1 strength until the end of the turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: LLDS Unlimited was born the day two designers answered the question "Why doesn't anyone make Diesel for computers?"
netrunnerCards.title: LLDS Processor

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines. 1[Credits]: +2 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor
netrunnerCards.title: Sharpshooter

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Trash any number of cards from your grip. For each trashed card of which you have another copy installed, draw 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor
netrunnerCards.title: Capstone

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, lose [Click]. Ignore any additional costs on each double event you play.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I like to say 'Traditional values for a modern time.' War in space and life made by human hands, machines smart enough to ask if they have souls…Religion is as important and relevent now as at any time in human history. We must rise to meet the new challenges. And we must have faith."
netrunnerCards.title: Starlight Crusade Funding

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 3 power counters on Rex Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Rex Campaign, trash it and either remove 1 bad publicity or gain 5[Credits].
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Rex Campaign.
netrunnerCards.title: Rex Campaign

netrunnerCards.text:
When you rez Fenris, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.
netrunnerCards.title: Fenris

netrunnerCards.text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
1[Credits]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.
netrunnerCards.title: Panic Button

netrunnerCards.text:
If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.
netrunnerCards.title: Shock!

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
netrunnerCards.title: Tsurugi

netrunnerCards.text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
netrunnerCards.title: TGTBT

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] for each card in the Runner's grip.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."
netrunnerCards.title: Sweeps Week

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot spend any credits for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal…strictly speaking.
netrunnerCards.title: RSVP

netrunnerCards.text:
If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
[Subroutine] End the game.
Just kidding.
netrunnerCards.title: Curtain Wall

netrunnerCards.text: Trace5– If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
netrunnerCards.title: Punitive Counterstrike

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Veterans Program, you may remove up to 2 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.
netrunnerCards.title: Veterans Program

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
netrunnerCards.title: Quest Completed

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [Click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
netrunnerCards.title: Hemorrhage

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever a gray ops or black ops operation is trashed after resolving, you may give the Corp 1 bad publicity and take 1 tag. [Trash]: Draw 1 card for each bad publicity the Corp has.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Stick with your plan and you'll be fine. Stick with the plan.
netrunnerCards.title: Tallie Perrault

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Reveal all cards in HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "When you need someone who is a little more hands on, look me up." -Silhouette
netrunnerCards.title: Executive Wiretaps

netrunnerCards.text: +2[Memory Unit] Whenever you expose a card, the Corp must rez it by paying its rez cost, if able. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The power of the focused mind is a power beyond comprehension.
netrunnerCards.title: Blackguard

netrunnerCards.text: +2[Memory Unit]
netrunnerCards.flavor: "CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
netrunnerCards.title: CyberSolutions Mem Chip

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
Use Alpha only on the outermost piece of ice protecting a server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The beginning…
netrunnerCards.title: Alpha

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
Use Omega only on the innermost piece of ice protecting a server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: …and the end?
netrunnerCards.title: Omega

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
Make a run. The Corp cannot rez ice for the duration of this run.
netrunnerCards.title: Blackmail

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].

Gain 5[Credits] and draw 2 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
netrunnerCards.title: Blue Level Clearance

netrunnerCards.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [Click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
netrunnerCards.title: Strongbox

netrunnerCards.text:
Toshiyuki Sakai can be advanced.
If Toshiyuki Sakai is accessed while installed, you may swap him with an agenda or asset from HQ. The new agenda or asset is installed unrezzed, and keeps all advancement tokens on Toshiyuki Sakai. The Runner can choose not to access the new card.
netrunnerCards.title: Toshiyuki Sakai

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
netrunnerCards.title: Yagura

netrunnerCards.text: Trash one of your installed sysops, executives, or clones. If you do, remove up to 2 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.
netrunnerCards.title: Restoring Face

netrunnerCards.text:
If the Runner is tagged when you score Market Research, place 1 agenda counter on it.
Market Research is worth 1 additional agenda point while it has an agenda counter on it.
netrunnerCards.title: Market Research

netrunnerCards.text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
netrunnerCards.title: Wraparound

netrunnerCards.text: You start the game with 10[Credits] and 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Geostrategic Research and Neothermal Development Laboratories
netrunnerCards.title: GRNDL: Power Unleashed

netrunnerCards.text:
When you score Vulcan Coverup, do 2 meat damage.
When the Runner steals Vulcan Coverup, take 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."
netrunnerCards.title: Vulcan Coverup

netrunnerCards.text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 4[Credits] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
netrunnerCards.flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.
netrunnerCards.title: GRNDL Refinery

netrunnerCards.text:
Gain 1[Credits]. Gain [Click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.
netrunnerCards.title: Subliminal Messaging

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards in the server at no cost (even if they cannot normally be trashed).
netrunnerCards.title: Singularity

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[Credits] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
netrunnerCards.title: Queen's Gambit

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using fracters.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Dyson Fractal Generator is a useless lump of silicon; all it does is produce truly random results. What kind of madman slaps that in his rig? What's the use of a totally random number? -John Masanori
netrunnerCards.title: Dyson Fractal Generator

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using killers.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Take Moore's Law, iterate it over a century or two, and mix in quantum computing. You get to the point where you're developing the software on a hardware platform that you design at the same time. Tailor-made for each other. Exciting time to be alive! -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage
netrunnerCards.title: Silencer

netrunnerCards.text:
You cannot use Savoir-faire more than once each turn.
2[Credits]: Install a program from your grip, paying the install cost.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Predictive algorithms that fetch you the program you need before you even know you need it. My second favorite lady." -Gabriel Santiago
netrunnerCards.title: Savoir-faire

netrunnerCards.text:
[Trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[Trash]: Gain 2[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
netrunnerCards.title: Fall Guy

netrunnerCards.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Gain 2[Credits]. Gain an additional 1[Credits] for each double event in your heap.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "When I said I could hack it in my sleep, did you think I was joking?" -Chaos Theory
netrunnerCards.title: Power Nap

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate or barrier until the end of the next run this turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
netrunnerCards.title: Paintbrush

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Gain 9[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.
netrunnerCards.title: Lucky Find

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2 until the start of the Corp's next turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.
netrunnerCards.title: Gyri Labyrinth

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.
netrunnerCards.title: Reclamation Order

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you are about to take at least 1 bad publicity, trace3– if successful, avoid taking the bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.
netrunnerCards.title: Broadcast Square

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. Draw 5 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Begin replaced by an android.
netrunnerCards.title: Corporate Shuffle

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.
netrunnerCards.title: Caprice Nisei

netrunnerCards.text: When you rez Shinobi, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trace1– If successful, do 1 net damage. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, do 2 net damage. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, do 3 net damage and end the run.
netrunnerCards.title: Shinobi

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
netrunnerCards.title: Marker

netrunnerCards.text:
Hive loses an "[Subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.title: Hive

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Remove up to 2 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Now, let's talk about how little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."
netrunnerCards.title: Witness Tampering

netrunnerCards.text:
The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4[Credits].
netrunnerCards.title: NAPD Contract

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.
netrunnerCards.title: Quandary

netrunnerCards.text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Evolving a Better You.
netrunnerCards.title: Harmony Medtech: Biomedical Pioneer

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Perfecting the Imperfect.
netrunnerCards.title: Nisei Division: The Next Generation

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
netrunnerCards.title: Tennin Institute: The Secrets Within

netrunnerCards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
netrunnerCards.title: House of Knives

netrunnerCards.text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."
netrunnerCards.title: Medical Breakthrough

netrunnerCards.text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Philotic Entanglement

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.
netrunnerCards.title: The Future Perfect

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
netrunnerCards.title: Chairman Hiro

netrunnerCards.text:
Gain 1[Credits] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.
netrunnerCards.title: Mental Health Clinic

netrunnerCards.text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
netrunnerCards.title: Psychic Field

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[Credits]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth −1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.
netrunnerCards.title: Shi.Kyū

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Swap 2 pieces of installed ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.
netrunnerCards.title: Tenma Line

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.title: Cerebral Cast

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 8[Credits]. The Runner gains 3[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease–of bioterrorism–demands that we continue our efforts."
netrunnerCards.title: Medical Research Fundraiser

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Install an asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in a new remote server. Place 3 advancement tokens on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.
netrunnerCards.title: Mushin No Shin

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.
netrunnerCards.title: Inazuma

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.title: Komainu

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Yip Yip!
netrunnerCards.title: Pup

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[Subroutine] The Runner accesses the top card of R&D unless the Corp pays 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.
netrunnerCards.title: Shiro

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-No-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.
netrunnerCards.title: Susanoo-No-Mikoto

netrunnerCards.text: The first time an advancement token is a placed on a card in this server each turn, gain 1[Credits]. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.
netrunnerCards.title: NeoTokyo Grid

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you would do any amount of net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[Credits] to do 1 brain damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.
netrunnerCards.title: Tori Hanzō

netrunnerCards.text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.
netrunnerCards.title: Plan B

netrunnerCards.text:
Guard cannot be bypassed.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…
netrunnerCards.title: Guard

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.
netrunnerCards.title: Rainbow

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] for each remote server with a card installed in it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
netrunnerCards.title: Diversified Portfolio

netrunnerCards.text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.
netrunnerCards.title: Fast Track

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, gain 2[Credits] if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Truth is a fickle mistress."
netrunnerCards.title: Iain Stirling: Retired Spook

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Try to keep up."
netrunnerCards.title: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Don't waste my time."
netrunnerCards.title: Silhouette: Stealth Operative

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] for each installed connection resource.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.
netrunnerCards.title: Calling in Favors

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only as your first click.
Make a run and gain [Click].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.
netrunnerCards.title: Early Bird

netrunnerCards.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.
netrunnerCards.title: Express Delivery

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on HQ. Bypass the first 2 pieces of ice encountered during this run. If the run is successful, you cannot access any cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.
netrunnerCards.title: Feint

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
netrunnerCards.title: Legwork

netrunnerCards.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.title: Planned Assault

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: Logos

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to play run events.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.
netrunnerCards.title: Public Terminal

netrunnerCards.text: Use Unregistered S&W '35 only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. [Click], [Click]: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in a server without paying its trash cost.
netrunnerCards.title: Unregistered S&W '35

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.
netrunnerCards.title: Window

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength. Alias cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.
netrunnerCards.title: Alias

netrunnerCards.text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[Credits]: +4 strength. Breach cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
netrunnerCards.title: Breach

netrunnerCards.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2[Credits] to reveal that card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.
netrunnerCards.title: Bug

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break tracer subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Catch me if you can!
netrunnerCards.title: Gingerbread

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
netrunnerCards.title: Grappling Hook

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[Credits]: +2 strength. Passport cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.
netrunnerCards.title: Passport

netrunnerCards.text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.
netrunnerCards.title: Push Your Luck

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.
netrunnerCards.title: Security Testing

netrunnerCards.text:
When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"
netrunnerCards.title: Theophilius Bagbiter

netrunnerCards.text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[Click]: Gain 2[Credits].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?
netrunnerCards.title: Tri-maf Contact

netrunnerCards.text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say–oops, too late, here we go!"
netrunnerCards.title: Mass Install

netrunnerCards.text:
+1[Memory Unit]
Trash Q-Coherence Chip when a program is trashed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.
netrunnerCards.title: Q-Coherence Chip

netrunnerCards.text: Place 1 power counter on Overmind when it is installed for each unused MU. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.title: Overmind

netrunnerCards.text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[Click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[Credits]. Otherwise, trash it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"
netrunnerCards.title: Oracle May

netrunnerCards.text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.
netrunnerCards.flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.
netrunnerCards.title: Donut Taganes

netrunnerCards.text: [Click][Click][Click]: Place 1 agenda counter on Domestic Sleepers. Domestic Sleepers is worth 1 agenda point while it has at least 1 agenda counter on it.
netrunnerCards.title: Domestic Sleepers

netrunnerCards.text: NEXT Silver gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.
netrunnerCards.title: NEXT Silver

netrunnerCards.text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
netrunnerCards.title: Lotus Field

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash a rezzed piece of ice.
Reveal cards from the top of R&D until you reveal a piece of ice. Install and rez that ice in the same position as the ice that was trashed, ignoring all costs. Shuffle R&D.
netrunnerCards.title: Mutate

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Only the News You Need.
netrunnerCards.title: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center

netrunnerCards.text:
3[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during traces.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Works better than a PAD hooked up to a tinfoil umbrella and coffee can.
netrunnerCards.title: Primary Transmission Dish

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner must pay 1[Credits] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break a subroutine during a run on this server. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Halfway upstalk, Midway is a destination unto itself with its microgravity hotels and fine dining options.
netrunnerCards.title: Midway Station Grid

netrunnerCards.text:
3[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to advance, install, and rez cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.
netrunnerCards.title: The Root

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, trash a piece of hardware. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash a piece of hardware.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Taurus promised strength, but gave only rage.
netrunnerCards.title: Taurus

netrunnerCards.text:
Mother Goddess gains the subtypes of all other rezzed ice.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios
netrunnerCards.title: Mother Goddess

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Galahad, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of the run, Galahad gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.
netrunnerCards.title: Galahad

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner's memory limit is reduced by 2 until the end of the turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Known as malware 0-394-41525-6 to sysops, runners just refer to it as "bad times."
netrunnerCards.title: Bad Times

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Choose a server. The Corp may rez a piece of ice protecting this server. If he or she does not, make a run on this server during which the Corp cannot rez ice.
netrunnerCards.title: Cyber Threat

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[Credits].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
netrunnerCards.title: Lamprey

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Remove all tags.
netrunnerCards.flavor: His eyes were beginning to blur, as he duplicated the credentials for what seemed like the fiftieth time. Perhaps a genetic refit would have been easier.
netrunnerCards.title: Paper Tripping

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever a trace is initiated.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines–there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago
netrunnerCards.title: Power Tap

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you encounter a piece of ice that was just rezzed, lose all credits in your credit pool. Gain credits equal to the rez cost of that ice.
netrunnerCards.title: Nasir Meidan: Cyber Explorer

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. If the Corp rezzes that piece of ice this turn, gain credits equal to its rez cost.
netrunnerCards.title: Social Engineering

netrunnerCards.text: Leprechaun can host up to 2 programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
netrunnerCards.title: Leprechaun

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may install Eden Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: The Corp draws 2 cards.
Limit 1 per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Eden Shard

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you rez a piece of ice each turn, you may search R&D for another copy of that ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
netrunnerCards.title: The Foundry: Refining the Process

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run not made through a card ability on his or her turn, the Runner must spend [Click].
netrunnerCards.title: Enhanced Login Protocol

netrunnerCards.text: If the Runner loses or spends a click during a run on this server, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "There are many advantages to having facilities on the moon. Less traffic, for example." -Director Hass
netrunnerCards.title: Heinlein Grid

netrunnerCards.text: All code gate ice have +1 strength. When you score Encrypted Portals, gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed code gate.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Binary computing  is obsolete. I use a base-4 structure for this system; it's modeled on our DNA. Well, my DNA, anyway." -Doctor Endo, Jinteki researcher
netrunnerCards.title: Encrypted Portals

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's identity text box is blank.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.
netrunnerCards.title: Cerebral Static

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Name a card. Gain 10[Credits] whenever the Runner plays or installs a copy of that card.
netrunnerCards.title: Targeted Marketing

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Information Overload, trace1– if the trace is successful, give the Runner 1 tag. Information Overload gains "[Subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards." for each tag the Runner has.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Throw enough data at a runner and it ceases to have any meaning at all.
netrunnerCards.title: Information Overload

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Gain 1[Credits] whenever the Runner makes a successful run.
netrunnerCards.title: Paywall Implementation

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Credits]: Move any number of credits from your credit pool to Sealed Vault.
[Click] or [Trash]: Move any number of credits from Sealed Vault to your credit pool.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Nothing is impenetrable. The key is to make breaking into it more costly than what it's worth.
netrunnerCards.title: Sealed Vault

netrunnerCards.text:
Ignore the install cost of the first piece of ice you install each turn.
Limit 1 per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Eden Fragment

netrunnerCards.text: This operation is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. All ice have +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I don't care how good your console is, or how tricked out your rig is. The lag time on a run on the moon from earthside can be a killer." -Leela Patel
netrunnerCards.title: Lag Time

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, you may trash Will-o'-the-Wisp. If you do, choose an icebreaker that was used to break at least 1 subroutine during this run. The Runner adds that icebreaker to the bottom of his or her stack.
netrunnerCards.title: Will-o'-the-Wisp

netrunnerCards.text: Place 3 power counters on D4v1d when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a strength of 5 or greater.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.
netrunnerCards.title: D4v1d

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first piece of ice encountered each turn has -2 strength for the remainder of the run.
netrunnerCards.title: Scrubbed

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only as your first [Click].
When this turn ends, gain 2[Credits] for each successful run you made during it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: In this business, you had to anticipate. If you weren't three steps ahead, you were three steps behind.
netrunnerCards.title: Three Steps Ahead

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot install more than 1 piece of ice each turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor: What goes up must always go down.
netrunnerCards.title: Unscheduled Maintenance

netrunnerCards.text: Place 3 virus counters on Cache when it is installed. Hosted virus counter: Gain 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette
netrunnerCards.title: Cache

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit during a run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Fifteen seconds of fame.
netrunnerCards.title: Net Celebrity

netrunnerCards.text: 3[Credits] or [Trash]: Prevent an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Originally not very popular, the regulator was overlooked by those who used energy sinks to protect their rig. But it quickly found an audience once Smoke casted a run on a Blue Sun server, using it to keep her rig online while repeatedly diverting energy spikes in excess of 50,000 volts.
netrunnerCards.title: LLDS Energy Regulator

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 3[Credits] on Ghost Runner when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Ghost Runner, trash it.
You can use the credits on Ghost Runner during a run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: In the spaces between the data, do trapped souls from the past persist?
netrunnerCards.title: Ghost Runner

netrunnerCards.text:
The rez cost of IQ is increased by 1 for each card in HQ.
IQ has +1 strength for each card in HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Created by merging the brainscans of over a hundred of the most intelligent people in Haas-Bioroid's cerebral database, its effectiveness is limited beither by its lack of imagination or the imagination of the sysops who employ it.
netrunnerCards.title: IQ

netrunnerCards.text: [Click],[Click],[Click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.
netrunnerCards.title: Eliza's Toybox

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The Corp may choose a card in HQ.  The runner access that card.  If he or she does, trash Kitsune.
netrunnerCards.flavor: There are those who believe the nine-tailed fox is an angel in disguise.  And then there are those who have followed, and discovered her secret...
netrunnerCards.title: Kitsune

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner cannot jack out while running on this server unless he or she trashes 1 installed program. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.
netrunnerCards.title: Port Anson Grid

netrunnerCards.text: The Runner cannot play current events.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "There are reports of a terrorist threat at Starport Kaguya.  The NAPD is offering a reward for anyone who can provide them with information about the current whereabouts of the individual pictured here.  He is considered extremely dangerous and is armed with a PAD and a portable rig."
netrunnerCards.title: The News Now Hour

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner makes a successful run each turn, trace2– if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.title: Manhunt

netrunnerCards.text: Wendigo can be advanced. While Wendigo has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains barrier and loses code gate. [Subroutine] Choose a program. The Runner cannot use the chosen program for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.title: Wendigo

netrunnerCards.text: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gargarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.
netrunnerCards.title: Crisium Grid

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford it-well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.
netrunnerCards.title: Chronos Project

netrunnerCards.text:
Shattered Remains can be advanced.
If you pay 1[Credits] when the Runner accesses Shattered Remains, trash 1 piece of hardware for each advancement token on Shattered Remains.
netrunnerCards.title: Shattered Remains

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
netrunnerCards.flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.
netrunnerCards.title: Lancelot

netrunnerCards.text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
netrunnerCards.title: Quetzal: Free Spirit

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break 1 barrier subroutine (or up to 3 subroutines if you spent a credit from a stealth card). 2[Credits]: +1 strength (or +2 strength if you spent at least 1 credit from a stealth card).
netrunnerCards.flavor: Bad luck for any sysop blind enough to cross its path.
netrunnerCards.title: BlacKat

netrunnerCards.text: [Click],[Click],[Click],[Click]: Draw 10 cards.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for–if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.
netrunnerCards.title: Duggar's

netrunnerCards.text: +2 [Memory Unit] Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: Box-E

netrunnerCards.text:
[Click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier.
When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the install cost by 2.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in town."
netrunnerCards.title: The Supplier

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +3 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "If you look like you belong, people will ignore you for hours.  Or years.  It's only when you don't fit inthat things start to go wrong." -Exile
netrunnerCards.title: Refractor

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you have no credits in your credit pool each turn, gain 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: There have been several attempts to create a "world church," uniting all human faiths into a single, harmonious whole.  The irongy, of course, is that each new "world church" is another schism in humanity's shared religious experience.
netrunnerCards.title: Order of Sol

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: Access all cards from Archives.
Limit 1 per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Hades Shard

netrunnerCards.text:
You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
Trash Rachel Beckman if you are tagged.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
"This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive."
Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."
netrunnerCards.title: Rachel Beckman

netrunnerCards.text:
Architect cannot be trashed while installed.
[Subroutine] The Corp looks at the top 5 cards of R&D and may install 1 of those cards, ignoring all install costs.
[Subroutine] The Corp may install a card from Archives or HQ (paying all costs).
netrunnerCards.flavor: Designed by 2012 World Champion Jeremy Zwirn
netrunnerCards.title: Architect

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Servers fully-armed and operational."
netrunnerCards.title: Peak Efficiency

netrunnerCards.text: Place 2 power counters on Labyrinthine Servers when you score it. Hosted power counter: Prevent the Runner from jacking out. The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run.
netrunnerCards.title: Labyrinthine Servers

netrunnerCards.text: Ashigaru gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The way past is to go a different way.
netrunnerCards.title: Ashigaru

netrunnerCards.text: Hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 power counter on Mamba.
netrunnerCards.title: Mamba

netrunnerCards.text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[Click], [Trash]: The Runner loses 4[Credits] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.
netrunnerCards.title: Reversed Accounts

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner loses 1[Credits] unless the Runner is tagged. If the Runner is tagged, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool and the Corp trashes Universal Connectivity Fee.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It's a small one-time fee, apparently. Only I've paid it seventeen times."
netrunnerCards.title: Universal Connectivity Fee

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ to gain credits equal to its rez cost.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Unlimited Energy. Reasonable Prices.
netrunnerCards.title: Blue Sun: Powering the Future

netrunnerCards.text: Changeling can be advanced. While Changeling has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains sentry and loses barrier. [Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.title: Changeling

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Trash any number of cards from HQ. Gain 2[Credits] for each card trashed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: If the clones were nervous about living in a repurposed fuel tank, they never mentioned it.
netrunnerCards.title: Reuse

netrunnerCards.text:
When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Hades Fragment

netrunnerCards.text:
[Click], [Click]: Place 1 power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
The install cost of the first card the Runner installs each turn is increased by 1 for each power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
netrunnerCards.title: Docklands Crackdown

netrunnerCards.text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[Credits] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal
netrunnerCards.title: Inject

netrunnerCards.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each copy of Origami installed.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The earliest instances of data folding were inspired by the traditional art of origami. Just as a crease pattern is the blueprint of a paper crane, there is a sequence to data that must be considered in order to achieve the greatest result.
netrunnerCards.title: Origami

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, he or she loses 2[Credits], if able.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "You should have known better than to scratch it…" -Quetzal
netrunnerCards.title: Fester

netrunnerCards.text:
The first time you install a program from your grip during your turn, gain [Click].
Trash Autoscripter if you make an unsuccessful run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It practically runs itself, unless you're in a pinch.
netrunnerCards.title: Autoscripter

netrunnerCards.text: 1[Credits]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card. 1[Credits]: +7 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Small. Compact. Easy to slip by monitoring programs and it can do some damage.
netrunnerCards.title: Switchblade

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.title: Trade-In

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan
netrunnerCards.title: Astrolabe

netrunnerCards.text: Place X power counters on Angel Arena when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Angel Arena, trash it. Hosted power counter: Reveal the top card of your stack. You may add that card to the bottom of your stack.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Low gravity sports are wildly popular, so match-fixing has proven wildly profitable." -Leela Patel
netrunnerCards.title: Angel Arena

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Bifrost Array, you may trigger the "when scored" ability of another agenda that is not a copy of Bifrost Array in your score area.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas
netrunnerCards.title: Bifrost Array

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, trash 1 program. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 program.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sagittarius promised foresight, but brought only regret.
netrunnerCards.title: Sagittarius

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Hostile Infrastructure), do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "If thou only knowest what it is to conquer, and knowest not what it is to be defeated; woe unto thee…" -Tokugawa Ieyasu
netrunnerCards.title: Hostile Infrastructure

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, do 1 net damage. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, do 1 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Gemini promised pleasure, but dealt only pain.
netrunnerCards.title: Gemini

netrunnerCards.text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "We've received seventeen crates from ChiLo. We'll hit stores the same day we sign the licence agreement."
netrunnerCards.title: License Acquisition

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you draw a card each turn, draw 1 additional card. Add 1 of the drawn cards to the bottom of R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"
netrunnerCards.title: Daily Business Show

netrunnerCards.text: All barrier ice have +1 strength. When you score Superior Cyberwalls, gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed barrier.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Our new barriers will be built on the rubble of our enemies".
netrunnerCards.title: Superior Cyberwalls

netrunnerCards.text:
When your turn begins, you may rez a card, lowering the rez cost by 1[Credits]. 
1[Credits],[Trash]: Search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Do it again, but this time I want to see you to enunciate less. Maybe let some spittle fly."
netrunnerCards.title: Executive Boot Camp

netrunnerCards.text: Lycan can be advanced.  While Lycan has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains code gate and loses sentry.  [Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It’s weird. I hit the server again and it was like a totally different piece of ice was waiting for me. Lost my root daemon. I shouldn’t have nested them seven deep."
netrunnerCards.title: Lycan

netrunnerCards.text: Trace3– If successful, trash 1 connection. The Runner can take 1 tag to prevent this.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The last thing he saw was the tattoo of a strange beast on his captor’s neck. It had a goat’s head, the body of a lion, and the tail of a serpent. Then the bag was yanked over his head, and there was only darkness.
netrunnerCards.title: Snatch and Grab

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Merlin, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Merlin gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: He who holds the staff of wisdom.
netrunnerCards.title: Merlin

netrunnerCards.text:
You cannot use Shell Corporation more than once per turn. 
[Click]: Place 3[Credits] on Shell Corporation. 
[Click]: Take all credits from Shell Corporation.
netrunnerCards.title: Shell Corporation

netrunnerCards.text: Your memory limit is equal to the number of cards in your grip.  Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Sometimes you just need a brain in a jar" -g00ru
netrunnerCards.title: Ekomind
