netrunnerCards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "He only likes to eat live meat." -MaxX
netrunnerCards.title: Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."
netrunnerCards.title: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist

netrunnerCards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Rex" H2 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Useful for fetching all sorts of things…but you better have a treat ready if he likes it." -Iain Stirling
netrunnerCards.title: Cerberus "Rex" H2

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 1[Credits] on Zona Sul Shipping when your turn begins.
[Click]: Take all credits from Zona Sul Shipping.
Trash Zona Sul Shipping if you are tagged.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "They’ll deliver anything to anywhere. Make sure to request air holes if you’re shipping someone important, though."
netrunnerCards.title: Zona Sul Shipping

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to install programs.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Cybsoft started by designing games. Eventually they just redesigned the same game each year, and to combat piracy created a dedicated machine to play it. Profits grew ten-fold.
netrunnerCards.title: Cybsoft MacroDrive

netrunnerCards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Lady" H1 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Its bytes are definitely worse than its bark." -Chaos Theory
netrunnerCards.title: Cerberus "Lady" H1

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, instead of accessing cards, you may install Utopia Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: The Corp discards 2 cards from HQ at random.
Limit 1 per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Utopia Shard

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Helium-3 Deposit, place up to 2 power counters on a card with at least 1 power counter on it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: It takes power to create power.
netrunnerCards.title: Helium-3 Deposit

netrunnerCards.text:
[Subroutine] The Corp gain 1[Credits] or draws 1 card.
[Subroutine] The Corp gain 1[Credits] or draws 1 card.
[Subroutine] The Corp gain 1[Credits] or draws 1 card.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Recycling the energy entering the system via a run is both responsible and economical.
netrunnerCards.title: Errand Boy

netrunnerCards.text: [Click]: Place 1 power counter on IT Department. Hosted power counter: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice has +1 strength until the end of the turn for each power counter (including the one spent) on IT Department.
netrunnerCards.title: IT Department

netrunnerCards.text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Markus 1.0.
[Subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The forge must never run cold.
netrunnerCards.title: Markus 1.0

netrunnerCards.text: The trash cost of each card is increased by 1 for each facedown card in Archives.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Achieve the Impossible.
netrunnerCards.title: Industrial Genomics: Growing Solutions

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever you create a server.
netrunnerCards.flavor: A masterpiece of cloning and hardware technology, Jinteki created homo vacuo operae, commonly called "turtlebacks", to operate for long periods of time within a vacuum.
netrunnerCards.title: Turtlebacks

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Rez 1 piece of ice for each tag the Runner has, ignoring all costs.
netrunnerCards.title: Shoot the Moon

netrunnerCards.text: When the Runner encounters Troll, trace2– if successful, the Runner must lose [Click] or end the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: You gotta pay the troll toll to get in.
netrunnerCards.title: Troll

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Virgo promised love, but offered only jealousy.
netrunnerCards.title: Virgo

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[Credits] for each advancement token on that agenda.
Limit 1 per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Utopia Fragment

netrunnerCards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot make another run this turn.
netrunnerCards.flavor:
There drew he forth the brand Excalibur,
And o'er him, drawing it, the winter moon,
Brightening the skirts of a long cloud, ran forth
And sparkled keen with frost against the hilt:
For all the haft twinkled with diamonds sparks,
Myriads of topaz-lights, and jacinth work
Of subtlest jewellery. -Lord Tennyson
netrunnerCards.title: Excalibur

netrunnerCards.text: Install only in a remote server. [Trash]: Trash all cards installed in or protecting this server and traceX– if successful, do 3 net damage. X is the number of cards trashed. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
netrunnerCards.title: Self-destruct

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Incubator. [Click], [Trash]: Move all virus counters from Incubator to another installed virus program.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "What terrors hatch in her dispossessed mind, waiting for their moment to be born? My money's on a double-helix rainbow with the head of a panda." -fakespeare
netrunnerCards.title: Incubator

netrunnerCards.text:
Whenever the Corp loses at least 1[Credits], gain 1[Credits].
Trash Ixodidae if the Corp purges virus counters.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Digs in deeper than its Alabama counterpart.
netrunnerCards.title: Ixodidae

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may search your stack for a program and install it, lowering the install cost by 3 for each piece of ice protecting R&D, and then take 1 tag. Shuffle your stack.
netrunnerCards.title: Code Siphon

netrunnerCards.text: Draw 1 card whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "All programs are connected. The data that runs through one runs through all." -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
netrunnerCards.title: Collective Consciousness

netrunnerCards.text: Sage has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[Credits]: Break code gate or barrier subroutine.
netrunnerCards.flavor: δὶς ἐς τὸν αὐτὸν ποταμὸν οὐκ ἂν ἐμβαίης
netrunnerCards.title: Sage

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[Credits] as an additional cost to rez the first unrezzed piece of ice approached.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Sometimes it's helpful to remember that you're not the only one who loves money." -Gabriel Santiago
netrunnerCards.title: Bribery

netrunnerCards.text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever you jack out.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The datastream slipped away, and it felt like being born for a second time, in only you could remember the first. A rush of air fills the lungs to bursting, and you gasp it out, coughing and choking as the dim lights of the room shine with the brilliance of a thousand suns.
netrunnerCards.title: Au Revoir

netrunnerCards.text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.
When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.
netrunnerCards.title: Earthrise Hotel

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever the Runner steals an agenda, he or she must either take 1 tag or suffer 2 meat damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: We Never Sleep.
netrunnerCards.title: Argus Security: Protection Guaranteed

netrunnerCards.text: As an additional cost to access a card in a remote server, the Runner must pay 1[Credits].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Sic Itur Ad Astra.
netrunnerCards.title: Gagarin Deep Space: Expanding the Horizon

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may place 1 agenda counter on it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: The Way Forward.
netrunnerCards.title: Titan Transnational: Investing In Your Future

netrunnerCards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Firmware Updates when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice that can be advanced. Use this ability only once per turn.
netrunnerCards.title: Firmware Updates

netrunnerCards.text:
Glenn Station can host a single card.
[Click]: Host a card from HQ facedown on Glenn Station.
[Click]: Add a card on Glenn Station to HQ.
netrunnerCards.title: Glenn Station

netrunnerCards.text:
[Click]: Gain 3[Credits].
Limit 1 Government Takeover per deck.
netrunnerCards.title: Government Takeover

netrunnerCards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on High-Risk Investment when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 1[Credits] for each credit in the Runner's credit pool.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Trust me. I know what I'm doing."
netrunnerCards.title: High-Risk Investment

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may move an advancement token from an installed piece of ice to an installed piece of ice that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "With distributed systems, assets can be realigned with no loss of efficiency." -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage
netrunnerCards.title: Constellation Protocol

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you spend an agenda counter, gain 1[Credits]. [Trash] or any agenda counter: Gain 2[Credits].
netrunnerCards.title: Mark Yale

netrunnerCards.text:
If Space Camp is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Space Camp, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Future leaders start here.
netrunnerCards.title: Space Camp

netrunnerCards.text:
Each agenda in the Runner's score area is worth 1 fewer agenda point.
If the Board is trashed while being accessed, add it to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
netrunnerCards.flavor: No one on the board knows everyone on it.
netrunnerCards.title: The Board

netrunnerCards.text:
Asteroid Belt can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: His belt of stone did shake and shatter.
netrunnerCards.title: Asteroid Belt

netrunnerCards.text:
Wormhole can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.
netrunnerCards.flavor: As through the door of light he came.
netrunnerCards.title: Wormhole

netrunnerCards.text:
Nebula can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
netrunnerCards.flavor: He bent his bow of stellar matter.
netrunnerCards.title: Nebula

netrunnerCards.text:
Orion can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.flavor: And seeking prey he then took aim.
netrunnerCards.title: Orion

netrunnerCards.text:
[Click]: Move this piece of ice to the outermost position protecting any server.
[Subroutine] Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice protecting this server that can be advanced.
[Subroutine] Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice protecting this server that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.title: Builder

netrunnerCards.text: When you rez Checkpoint, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trace5– If successful, do 3 meat damage when this run is successful.
netrunnerCards.title: Checkpoint

netrunnerCards.text:
Fire Wall can be advanced and gains +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
netrunnerCards.title: Fire Wall

netrunnerCards.text: Searchlight can be advanced. X is the number of advancement tokens on Searchlight. [Subroutine]Tracex– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine]Tracex– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.title: Searchlight

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner installs a card each turn, he or she must trash 1 card from his or her grip.
netrunnerCards.title: Accounting

netrunnerCards.text: Install Patch on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition with the text "Host ice has +2 strength."
netrunnerCards.title: Patch

netrunnerCards.text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 2 tags.
Do 2 meat damage.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Traffic was murder."
netrunnerCards.title: Traffic Accident

netrunnerCards.text: Each piece of ice protecting this server is considered to have 1 additional advancement token on it. Limit 1 region per server.
netrunnerCards.title: Satellite Grid

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever the Runner passes a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server, you can reveal and trash another copy of that ice from HQ to force the Runner to encounter the piece of ice just passed again.
netrunnerCards.title: The Twins

netrunnerCards.text: Install Sub Boost on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice gains barrier and "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines."
netrunnerCards.flavor: "It's fun watching them derez after hitting Enigma." -Grace Lamarr, Freelance Security Expert
netrunnerCards.title: Sub Boost

netrunnerCards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install ice protecting this server.
netrunnerCards.title: Dedicated Technician Team

netrunnerCards.text:
If the Runner accesses Cyberdex Virus Suite from R&D, reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Cyberdex Virus Suite, you may purge virus counters.
[Trash]: Purge virus counters.
netrunnerCards.title: Cyberdex Virus Suite

netrunnerCards.text: Trash the first operation you access each turn at no cost.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "My only regret is that androids cannot feel my hate."
netrunnerCards.title: Edward Kim: Humanity's Hammer

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, trash the top 2 cards of your stack. Draw 1 card.
netrunnerCards.title: MaxX: Maximum Punk Rock

netrunnerCards.text: The Corp starts the game with 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Everyone deserves a chance. Everyone."
netrunnerCards.title: Valencia Estevez: The Angel of Cayambe

netrunnerCards.text: Gain [Click] [Click] [Click] and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented).
netrunnerCards.flavor: "The human brain only uses like a quarter of its capacity anyway, right?" -MaxX
netrunnerCards.title: Amped Up

netrunnerCards.text:
Draw 3 cards.
Whenever Steelskin is trashed by taking net or meat damage, draw 3 cards.
netrunnerCards.title: Steelskin

netrunnerCards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1 for each bad publicity he or she has.
netrunnerCards.flavor: No one knows what they want–least of all them.
netrunnerCards.title: Itinerant Protesters

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards from the top of R&D, access cards from the bottom of R&D (starting with the bottom card and work your way up).
netrunnerCards.title: Showing Off

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may spend any number of [Click] to force the Corp to trash an equal number of cards from HQ at random.
netrunnerCards.title: Wanton Destruction

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click] [Click] [Click].
Gain 10[Credits].
netrunnerCards.title: Day Job

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a sentry during this run, trash that sentry.
netrunnerCards.title: Forked

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a barrier during this run, trash that barrier.
netrunnerCards.title: Knifed

netrunnerCards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a code gate during this run, trash that code gate.
netrunnerCards.title: Spooned

netrunnerCards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine. You cannot access more than 0 cards for the remainder of this run.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Nom nom nom.
netrunnerCards.title: Eater

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever an installed Corp card is trashed, place 1 virus counter on Harbinger. [Click], hosted virus counter: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
netrunnerCards.title: Harbinger

netrunnerCards.text: Place 1 virus counter on Hivemind when it is installed. Virus counters on Hivemind are considered to be hosted on all other virus programs (and can be spent as if on them).
netrunnerCards.title: Hivemind

netrunnerCards.text: You may host a single virus program on Progenitor. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit. Whenever virus counters are purged, remove all but 1 virus counter from the hosted card.
netrunnerCards.title: Progenitor

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever you access cards in Archives, remove 1 card in Archives from the game, instead of accessing it.
netrunnerCards.title: Archives Interface

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards. If you do, draw 1 card or remove 1 tag.
netrunnerCards.title: Salvager

netrunnerCards.text: +3[Memory Unit] Use the MU on MemStrips only for virus programs.
netrunnerCards.title: MemStrips

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit] When your turn begins, draw 1 card if the Corp has cards in HQ equal to his or her maximum hand size. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "Show me your faith without deeds, if you can."
netrunnerCards.title: Vigil

netrunnerCards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, gain credits equal to the agenda points on that agenda.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "They showed me that I wasn't broken. I am still a whole human, no matter how many limbs I lose. The golems are our enemy, as well as anyone who values efficiency and profit more than a human life." -Edward Kim
netrunnerCards.title: Human First

netrunnerCards.text:
Install only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
[Click],[Click],[Click],[Click],[Trash]: Give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Her heart beat faster as her reader illuminated the records. It was all there. The pod had not been reprogrammed since the 14th, which meant that this was a case of gross negligence.
netrunnerCards.title: Investigative Journalism

netrunnerCards.text: [Trash]: Prevent all damage. Trash all installed hardware, all installed non-virtual resources, and all cards in your grip. Lose all credits. Remove all tags.
netrunnerCards.title: Sacrificial Clone

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, if there are 2 or more power counters on Stim Dealer, remove all power counters from it and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented); otherwise, place 1 power counter on Stim Dealer and gain [Click].
netrunnerCards.flavor: Her eyes were the color of dreams and disasters.
netrunnerCards.title: Stim Dealer

netrunnerCards.text:
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground.
[Click]: Move 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground to another card with at least 1 virus counter on it.
netrunnerCards.flavor: Scraps of code drifting around the network can congeal into pools of data. Within this primordial soup the code breaks, re-assemble, mutates. Evolves.
netrunnerCards.title: Virus Breeding Ground

netrunnerCards.text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip.
netrunnerCards.title: Uninstall

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, you may lose [Click]. If you do, avoid the first tag you would take until the start of your next turn.
netrunnerCards.title: Qianju PT

netrunnerCards.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[Credits] if you have 2 or more unused MU.
netrunnerCards.title: Data Folding

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you make a successful run each turn, the Corp reveals 1 card at random from HQ.
netrunnerCards.title: Enhanced Vision

netrunnerCards.text: Genetics also trigger the second time each turn their trigger condition is met.
netrunnerCards.title: Gene Conditioning Shoppe

netrunnerCards.text:
Before taking your first turn, you may swap this card with any copy of Jinteki Biotech.
[Click],[Click],[Click]: Flip this identity.
The Brewery: When you flip this identity, do 2 net damage.
The Tank: When you flip this identity, shuffle Archives into R&D.
The Greenhouse: When you flip this identity, place 4 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
netrunnerCards.title: Jinteki Biotech: Life imagined

netrunnerCards.text: When you score Genetic Resequencing, you may place 1 agenda counter on an agenda in your score area.
netrunnerCards.title: Genetic Resequencing

netrunnerCards.text: The first time you install a card each turn, you may install another card of the same type from your grip (paying its install cost).
netrunnerCards.title: Hayley Kaplan: Universal Scholar

netrunnerCards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
If you have fewer cards in your grip than your maximum hand size, draw cards until you have cards in your grip equal to your maximum hand size.
netrunnerCards.title: Game Day

netrunnerCards.text: +1[Memory Unit] The first time you play an event each turn, you may play another event (without spending a click) after the first one resolves. Limit 1 console per player.
netrunnerCards.title: Comet

netrunnerCards.text:
When your turn begins, lose [Click].
Your maximum hand size is increased by 5.
netrunnerCards.flavor: "So much to do. So little time."
netrunnerCards.title: Beach Party
